title: Error Label Frames GUI: Gtk-WARNING (deeplabcut 2.1)
body:
**Describe the bug**
By following the DeepLabCut Project Manager GUI: Tutorial i realised that during the step3: labeling process i am getting the following error: (part of the error)
```
(ipython:16313): Gtk-WARNING **: 10:50:25.172: Negative content height -11 (allocation 1, extents 6x6) while allocating gadget (node button, owner GtkButton)

(ipython:16313): Gtk-WARNING **: 10:50:25.173: Negative content height -11 (allocation 1, extents 6x6) while allocating gadget (node button, owner GtkButton)

(ipython:16313): Gtk-WARNING **: 10:53:02.007: Negative content height -11 (allocation 1, extents 6x6) while allocating gadget (node button, owner GtkButton)

(ipython:16313): Gtk-WARNING **: 10:53:02.007: Negative content height -11 (allocation 1, extents 6x6) while allocating gadget (node button, owner GtkButton)

(ipython:16313): Gtk-WARNING **: 10:53:02.007: Negative content height -11 (allocation 1, extents 6x6) while allocating gadget (node button, owner GtkButton)

```
**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Label Frames'
2. Click on 'Ok' and then Load frames
3. Try to click on the bodyparts
4. See error

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
![Screenshot from 2019-10-07 10-52-59](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55577749/66294490-c87e6600-e8f1-11e9-8644-40b20e82f57b.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 18.04
 - DeepLabCut Version: 2.1


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
